etymology.description: semantic: 艹 (cǎo, "grass") + phonetic: 枼 (yè, "leaf") = vegetation-like and phonetic element -> leaf
etymology.interpretation: In 叶(葉) (yè, "leaf"), the 艹 (cǎo, "grass") component suggests vegetation, while 枼 (yè, "leaf") provides the sound. This combination aptly conveys the meaning of a leaf, aligning both meaning and pronunciation.
etymology.simplification: In the simplified form 叶(葉), the component 艹 (cǎo, "grass") is removed, and 枼 (yè, "leaf") alone suggests both the phonetic and semantic aspects, reducing the complexity by focusing solely on the phonetic element.

examples.chinese: 秋风起时(秋風起時)，落叶纷纷飘落(落葉紛紛飄落)。
examples.pinyin: Qiū fēng qǐ shí, luò yè fēn fēn piāo luò.
examples.english: When the autumn wind rises, the leaves fall one after another.

examples.chinese: 树上的叶很美(樹上的葉很美)。
examples.pinyin: Shù shàng de yè hěn měi.
examples.english: The leaves on the tree are beautiful.

examples.chinese: 他轻轻地拿起一片叶(他輕輕地拿起一片葉)，仔细端详(仔細端詳)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qīng qīng de ná qǐ yī piàn yè, zǐ xì duān xiáng.
examples.english: He gently picked up a leaf and examined it carefully.
